ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Pessiglione Task - Did they choose the better_stim?
Block Number
Pessiglione Task - Stimulus pair (eg, 'AB')
Pessiglione Task - Best element of the stimulus pair (eg, 'A')
Pessiglione Task - Percentage of time a given pair is valid
Pessiglione Task - Participant Response
Notes: 1 = Left arrow keys; 2 = Right arrow keys; allowable responses are left and right arrow keys (ascii codes 37 and 39)

ElementDescription: Pessiglione Task - What kind of rewards were offered - points or bonus money?
Pessiglione Task - Is it a win:stay or avoid:lose trials?
Notes: 1 = Win:stay; 2 = Avoid:lose; Win:stay trials allow you to win or keep your money; avoid:lose allow you to lose or avoid losing money.

ElementDescription: Reaction Time
Pessiglione Task - Which of the two images is most often rewarded?
Pessiglione Task - Which feedback image is displayed?
Pessiglione Task - Which image is presented on the left of the screen?
Pessiglione Task - Which image is presented on the right of the screen?
Pessiglione Task - Which set of images are used as the stimuli?
Pessiglione Task - Block type
Trial number
Pessiglione Task - Does the feedback provide accurate or inaccurate information on the current stimulus pair values?
